resources:
Version %s App developed by Ferdinando Traversa for Wiki Loves Monuments.
 The blue pin indicates a monument that has photographs, the red pin indicates a monument that does not yet have any photographs.
 Tree icon modified by symbolon, CC-BY 3.0 license.
 Navigation bar icons modified by FontAwesome, CC-BY-SA 4.0 license Something went wrong! Make sure you have geolocation enabled and restart the app or click refresh. A connection error occurred: %s.Retry later. An error occurred: %s. Retry later. Enable geolocation to use the map. Unable to locate you, you have not given permission to locate. Search for a city by clicking on the magnifying glass or enable localization from your privacy settings. Accept Refuse Do you want to share some usage data with the developer of this application and in particular crash data, so that you can contribute to its improvement, via the Flurry platform? Usage and crash data No results found! Try another search Enter a minimum of 3 characters to perform a search. You have cancelled uploading photos You may not have granted permission to access the photo gallery. Verify. An error occurred with the keychain reading, please try again later. Registration incomplete! Log in to Wikimedia Commons to continue. The authorization on this monument is elapsed More infos on %s How do you want to reach %s? By car On foot By bike Without active geolocation I am unable to plot a route! As requested, your registration has been cancelled. Reopen this tab to start a new one and upload your photographs. Your registration has been cancelled due to a problem. Reopen this tab to start a new one and upload your photographs. Ok Your data could not be deleted from the server. Make sure to revoke the oAuth authorization. You have accessed the test Wiki. From now on you can go back and upload your photos via the appropriate button in the tab of each monument. Your photos will not be actually uploaded. You are now logged in to Wikimedia Commons, you can go back and upload your photos using the button in the tab of each monument. Your username is %s. Login to Wikimedia Commons You are not logged in. Click on login to Wikimedia Commons to do so. Something went wrong, retry later. If it happens again, please log out and log in again. Before you can upload photographs, you must be logged into Wikimedia Commons. Image not uploaded due to error. Image not uploaded due to error: %s. An error has occurred. Log out from the Upload Settings Manager in the settings tab. Error uploading this image, please try again later. Image Title Image description Photo Date (dd/mm/aaaa) Warning: the date format must be dd/mm/yyyyy such as 11/05/2005. The fields are mandatory! Fill them all out before uploading (or hit enter on your keyboard if you have). Photos successfully queued for upload! You can check their status in the settings. Something went wrong and the upload failed. Please try again later: %s.. Warning! You are using an outdated version of the app (%1$s). Go to the store and download the new version %2$s.. Info about Wiki Loves Monuments Credits and meaning of colors. Manage upload settings. Uploaded photos Wiki Loves Monuments is an international contest that aims to illustrate Wikipedia and Wikimedia projects through photographs of cultural heritage taken by citizens themselves, thus being also a great opportunity for tourism promotion.
It was born in 2010 and is organized annually around the world, in more than 50 countries, from 1 to 30 September.\In 2012 it entered the Guinness Book of Records as the largest photo contest in the world. Each year, more than 130,000 photographs are uploaded.
The subject of the images allowed to participate in the competition are monuments, a very broad set that includes buildings, sculptures, archaeological sites, architectural structures but also natural sites and landscape assets. All photographs are released under a free license and published on Wikimedia Commons, the large database that illustrates Wikipedia (the 5th most visited site in Italy) and all other projects with multimedia content (photos and videos). 
Wiki Loves Monuments is open to the participation of everyone, professional photographers or amateurs, with no age limit. 
The Italian edition is organized since 2012 by Wikimedia Italia, an association that has been working since 2005 to spread knowledge and free culture in Italy, as a chapter of Wikimedia Foundation. Visit the contest website Map Insert the name of the city... Insert the name of the monument... Found Monuments Found cities Search by name Monument Upload your photos Only photos uploaded from September 1 to 30 will participate in Wiki Loves Monuments. Driving directions More info Wikipedia article From here you can control the settings related to your Wikimedia account with particular reference to the photo upload functionality from the app. Upload settings management Login to Wikimedia Commons Verify access Logout To continue, login or create an account on Wikimedia Commons by clicking the blue button above. If you have already logged in, click the button to verify that you are logged in. By Date By Name Monument info Uploaded photo list Photo upload Images already uploaded Images to upload I agree to irrevocably release these images under the Creative Commons-Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 license. I understand that they will be published on Wikimedia Commons and will be reusable in perpetuity under the terms of that license. I also declare to be the author of the images. I am aware that the criminal and civil responsibility for what I upload is my own. Confirm and upload Cancel Monuments Cities Close By Name Settings
